intro: Rauvolfia strempelioides, commonly known as the African snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a climbing vine with heart-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, white or greenish flowers. The plant is characterized by its milky sap and is often found in humid, shaded environments. Its roots and leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes other plants with similar medicinal properties.
